title: Legal Information | bsport's Legal Notices
content:
1. Website presentation

Owner : BSPORT SAS – 30/32 boulevard de Sébastopol, 75004 Paris– France

  • Registration number: registered under number 838 682 011, RCS Paris
  • VAT number: ESB01889922

Creator : Agence Digidop

Publication manager : marketing@bsport.io

Webmaster : marketing@bsport.io

Customer Service: support@bsport.io

CEO: Zakaria Mansour

2. Terms and conditions of website use and offered services

By using the bsport.io website, the user is deemed to have implicitly and unreservedly agreed to these terms and conditions of use. These terms and conditions of use may be modified or supplemented at any time. Users of the bsport.io website should regularly review these terms and conditions.

The website is normally available to users at all times. Nonetheless,BSPORT may decide to prevent access to perform technical maintenance, in which case every effort will be made to notify users in advance of the time and date of the interruption.

BSPORT updates the bsport.io website on a regular basis. The legal notice may also be modified at any time. It will be binding on the user, who should regularly read the legal notice in order to be aware of any changes.

3. Description of provided services

The purpose of the bsport.io website is to provide information about the company’s activities.

BSPORT endeavours to provide precise information on the bsport.io website insofar as possible. However, it may not be held liable for any omissions, inaccuracies or lack of updates whether of its own doing or of that of partner third parties providing the information concerned.

All information given on bsport.io is for reference purposes only and is subject to modifications. Moreover, the information on bsport.io is not exhaustive and may undergo changes after being placed online.

4. Contractual limits on technical aspects

This website uses Webflow technology.The website may not be held liable for any material damages linked to its use. The website user agrees to access the website using modern equipment that does not contain any viruses and with an up-to-date web browser.

5. Interllectual property and breaches

BSPORT is the owner of the intellectual property and usage rights pertaining to all elements accessible on the website, including texts, images, graphics, logos, icons, audio and software.

Except where authorised in writing beforehand by BSPORT, it is prohibited to reproduce, depict, modify, publish or adapt any element of the website, in whole or in part, regardless of the means or procedure used.

Any unauthorised exploitation of the website or of an element contained therein will constitute an infringement of intellectual property rights and will be prosecuted in accordance with Articles L.335-2 et seq. of the French Intellectual Property Code.

6. Liability disclaimer

BSPORT may not be held liable for any direct or indirect damages caused to the user’s equipment during access to the bsport.io website and resulting from either the use of equipment not fulfilling the specifications set out in point 4 above or the occurrence of a bug or incompatibility.

Furthermore, BSPORT may not be held liable for any indirect damages ensuing from the use of the bsport.io website.

7. Management of personal data

BSPORT does not store the personal data of users who connect to the bsport.io website.

8. Hypertext links and cookies

When browsing the bsport.io website, cookies may be installed on the user’s computer. A cookie is a small text file. It does not identify the user but it records information relating to the user’s browsing of a website. The data obtained is used to facilitate subsequent browsing of the website and enable various measurements of visit frequency.

The bsport.io website uses analytical cookies.

However, the user may change the settings of the computer to reject cookies as follows:

On Internet Explorer: Select the tools button (gear cog icon on upper right) / ‘Internet options’. Click ‘Privacy’ and select ‘Block all cookies’. Click Ok.

On Firefox: at the top of the browser, click the menu button and go to ‘Options’. Select ‘Privacy and security’. Set ‘Firefox will choose:’ to ‘Use custom settings for history’. Uncheck cookies to deactivate them.

On Safari: Click on the menu icon at the top-right of the browser (gear cog symbol). Select ‘Preferences’. Click ‘Display advanced settings’. In the ‘Privacy’ section, click on ‘Content settings’. Under ‘Cookies’, you can choose to block cookies.

Google Analytics cookies

The data collected by means of the cookies deposited by this website are collected by Google Analytics. You can see here the privacy policy of Google Analytics. If you want to see in detail the uses of Google Analytics Cookies.

9. Applicable law and jurisdiction

Any dispute in relation to the use of the bsport.io website is subject to French law. The competent courts of Paris shall have exclusive jurisdiction to hear such disputes.

10. Principal legislation

Law no. 78-17 of 6 January 1978, as amended by Law no. 2004-801 of 6 August 2004, on computer technology, files and freedoms.

Law no. 2004-575 of 21 June 2004 on enhancing confidence in the digital economy.

11. Glossary

  • User: a person who connects to and browses the above-mentioned website. * Personal data: “information of any form that allows the direct or indirect identification of a natural person to whom the data refers” (Article 4 of Law no. 78-17 of 6 January 1978).

excerpt: Explore bsport's legal notices, including terms of use, privacy policy, and cookie policy. Find all legal information here.
